metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2086 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Node.js 0.10.x before 0.10.42, 0.12.x before 0.12.10, 4.x before 4.3.0, and5.x before 5.6.0 allow remote attackers to conduct HTTP request smugglingattacks via a crafted Content-Length HTTP header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 8.10.0~dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.10.0~dfsg-2').
